website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight and inexpensive but doesn't perform as well as other models.
pros: Contains a removable aluminum splint, providing stiff or flexible support
Works well for nighttime or light day use
cons: Arrives with an unpleasant smell that dissipates with time
One size fits all doesn't work for small hands
Some models contain a plastic splint

customer_reviews.title: Very bad product!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this item because: 1) It hurts thumb (see the attached picture) 2) it chemically smells and your hand will smell awful too 3) the strap between thumb and index fingers is too thick and will be scratching your wrist 4) You can't return this item "This item isn't eligible for return."
customer_reviews.author: alexkenny

customer_reviews.title: Quick delievery and thrifty price
customer_reviews.text: I developed a condition known as ulnar neuropathy in my left hand. This was caused by pulling too many weeds. I purchased a wrist brace from VIVE to help stabliize the wrist and it worked wonderfully. I would encourage anyone whom has carpal tunnel or another similar condition to get one of these wrist braces. They were priced right and delivered quickly by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: charles hicks

customer_reviews.title: These wrist braces are truly GREAT! Was experiencing numbness and other symptoms of Carpel ...
customer_reviews.text: These wrist braces are truly GREAT! Was experiencing numbness and other symptoms of Carpel Tunnel every night while trying to sleep. Started using these on each wrist and they really work! The numbness and hand falling "asleep" while I sleep has gone away. I used them for a couple of weeks and then tried to sleep without them. The symptoms returned. Used them again, symptoms gone. I did this several times just to be sure. They really work, at least for me.
customer_reviews.author: TonyS

customer_reviews.title: Am I ever glad I did
customer_reviews.text: These braces are making it possible for my 15-year old daughter to continue playing the sports she loves. She was recently diagnosed with juvenile arthritis, and her hands are the most affected. We have tried several other braces, but they didn't give her the support she needed. We thought that she would have to give up her activities. Then I found these, and thought I'd give them a try. Am I ever glad I did!! I love the removable splint. She can keep it in for volleyball, and take it out for gymnastics. Thank you - you have truly changed my daughter's life, and now she is looking forward to the new school year!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Voros

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SUPPORTIVE  WRAP!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 11 year old for soccer. She couldn't wear here other bulky brace so purchased this one. Super supportive without the bulk and fits extremely well. I tried it on as well and fits me perfectly, so great for all wrist sizes . Definitely recommend! Also easy to wash and clean to get that hand smell funk out ;)!
customer_reviews.author: A McD

customer_reviews.title: Durable and well-made
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a few months. I don’t think any effective stiff brace can be considered comfortable, but this is pretty tolerable! Admittedly, I have sensitive skin and smaller hands and shorter fingers than most (wrist circumference 7”, wrist to top of middle finger 7”, hand width 3.5”). I regularly air it out and wipe down with alcohol wipes or spray with Lysol and it’s held up really well. I ended fashioning a cotton inner lining using an old tee shirt which made it much comfier (no one can see it so it doesn’t matter if the lining looks crap!). All in all, I’d recommend it - it’s well constructive and durable.
customer_reviews.author: MacDoodle

customer_reviews.title: Eh quality.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this one would be more comfortable than the other one I have and I was very disappointed. 1) it rubs against my thumb, so it’s all chaffed. 2) the metal piece inside is super stiff and digs into my arm. 3) the velcro causes the wrist band to be all linty looking and old. I was very disappointed, it gets the job done but quality is definitely not there.
customer_reviews.author: momobear

customer_reviews.title: Works good but left a "smelly feet"  essence  in my hand
customer_reviews.text: The brace works fine but the material is not breathable. I slept with the brace on at nights, which led to my hand smell like "stinky feet" after a week of use. I put it in the washer but the smell kept on returning after one night of use. I had to wash my hands several times in order to remove the smell. I brush my children teeth in the morning, and they will let me know that my hand smelled bad. The stability of the brace wore out after 4-5months, the metal holders keep on coming out of the pockets. If it wasn't for the unbreathable material, it would have been perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: First disappointment: ordered a right wrist brace and was shipped a left wrist brace. Second disappointment: the product is poorly made. I received the product on a Monday and by Thursday the section the Velcro attaches to looked worn and started lifting off the backing. Don't waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be helping
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what’s going on with my wrist but several people suggested carpal tunnel. Following some tips like a brace at night. The brace at night seems to be helping. It’s alright. My only complaint Wild be the thumb hole. For some reason when I put it as right as I need for it to help, it digs into my thumb to the point where it leaves marks.(nothing really painful just uncomfortable.) Maybe it’s the brace. Maybe it’s how I ’m sleeping with my. I don’t know. Overall it seems to be helping.
customer_reviews.author: MamaK

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have issues with carpal tunnel in both wrists. I ordered both wrist braces. Neither one worked to stabilize my wrists. They were made with good quality. But the design in which they were made caused them to not work at all. Any time I tried to tightened the brace, the metal that holds the wrist in place moved with the brace. No matter how I tight I made them, it did not stabilize my wrists. I never write bad reviews, but this was just a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan & Terri Burns

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: There are two Velcro tabs which hold the brace on the wrist. The wrist tab is okay, but there second tab which goes between the thumb and finger is very narrow, only 1/4" x 1" of Velcro to hold it on. Move your hand very much, or try to pick something up and the Velcro tab pops off. So you are continuously refastening the Velcro tab in order to keep it on. Threw the brace away. At same time I bought a Copper Compression Recovery Wrist Brace. Both of the Velcro tabs on this are large and seem to hold well. Much better.
customer_reviews.author: len bowen

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to be a good product, but.....
customer_reviews.text: The materials used are not that good, the Velcro by the thumb stopped attaching, the fabric by the thumb started to come apart.
customer_reviews.author: Rafa

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I really like this wrist brace; it's comfortable and wraps perfectly (also its kinda stylish). My two minor issues with it that prevent me from giving this a 5 star is: It was a little uncomfortable to get used to at first and the velcro around the finger presses a little too tight, even when I take it off and reapply it. Other than that, it's a great product and I might buy one for my left hand after a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: These only lasted about a month before the velcro on the small strap stopped gripping-i would wake up and the strap would not be in place. I worked nights and slept all day. When I took off the brace, my hands were covered in sweat and smelled all night. Other areas of the brace started to fail, especially around the thumb seam. I didn't bother asking for a refund. I bought two better quality braces from my local grocery store and have been happy with those.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dulaney

customer_reviews.title: Ummmm... no.
customer_reviews.text: This is the single worst brace I’ve worn yet. The metal shim that braces the inside of your wrist pokes out of either end of its enclosure, and if you have to lift anything of consequence, you’ll need at least a band-aid, if not stitches on your forearm. It also places undue stress on the first metacarpal bone (the bone in the hand for the index finger), which in itself causes substantial pain. After one day, I could see the wear on the Velcro. And I’ve smelled some pretty bad tequila that smells a whole lot better than this pile of c**p. After one day, it’s finding its rightful place in my home - the garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: A sprain of my palmer ligament required mandatory immobilization of my wrist. This looked comfy for it’s minimalist design. I have big hands and it was very difficult to find a fit that didn’t require fidgeting with the velcro tab. My hot hands sweat a lot in this glove. The band required a very tight fit in order to find any support. Tight enough that flirted with the fine line between a support device and a Tourniquet.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: This brace worked very well for my De Quervain's Tenosynovitis for the first 2 weeks. The velcro straps are designed to adhere directly to the brace fabric. Within the 2 weeks of wear, the brace fabric became frayed to the point that the Velcro would no longer hold making the brace unwearable. The top strap around the thumb pinches when pulled tight enough to provide proper support. Would strongly suggest purchasing one with proper Velcro straps, as will be my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty middling product
customer_reviews.text: Only owned it for a week and already the velcro is fraying along with the stitching around the corners. It works as advertised but I wouldn't account on high durability.
customer_reviews.author: MohawkADE

customer_reviews.title: Better options available
customer_reviews.text: I have bought other wrist braces that are nicer than this one. It is not for smaller hands. However, the material quickly became worn looking due to the velcro ripping it up. If you are hot-natured, you may not want this brace. The material is fairly thick and not too breathble. Also, the small strap that goes between the thumb and index finger became curled on the edges after only a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Porterfield

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the brace for my wife who was experiencing numbness in her fingers, and pain at the finger tips. After just a few days, the pain subsided, and the numbness has been reduced. The brace is comfortable, easy to use, and adjustable. She wears it all night and a good part of the day. Good value, good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have worn 1 day and already ripping
customer_reviews.text: The brace itself fits kind of weird but does its job. The biggest problem is that I have worn it exactly a day and the finger hole is already ripping for some reason. Poor quality. I’m going to keep it because I need something right now and buy a different brace.
customer_reviews.author: Gabi G

customer_reviews.title: Good Product-Not Great but Good
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product. Very comfortable. I gave three stars because two weeks after wearing the brace it starting slightly coming apart around the hole for the thumb. I was using it a couple times a week. Now I only use it when I absolutely have to wear it until I can purchase brace.
customer_reviews.author: Tonia

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a sprained wrist and no matter how tight or loose I put it, it did literally nothing for immobilizing my wrist. I’m going back to the old rinky dink one my grandmother gave me at least it helps a little.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not the one for me
customer_reviews.text: First few days, first week I loves. Soft, and stable... I have trouble with making too loose vs too tight. The material frays from the Velcro. The thumb hole is a bit weird. I don't know how it compares to others bc it's the first I tried but I'm gonna try a different one. I will look at design, materials, and amount of immobilization; I don't want my wrist to be able to turn. That might be unrealistic without securing my small finger to the elbow but I'm hoping to find something comfortable that will immobilize my wrist. This one would be best for infrequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great wrist brace
customer_reviews.text: Wow! what a great brace. It is very hard to find a brace that fits and it comfortable but this one is. Relieves pain and very comfortable to wear. Easy to slip on and off and the adjustable straps stretch without pulling hard. In fact I bought a Vive wrist brace with thumb stabilizer and that is also great. I would recommend Vive braces to anyone who has problems with their wrist and/or thumbs.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Wetterling

customer_reviews.title: I love the brace, very comfortable and helps so much! Give it a try!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this was going to be a good brace but after wearing on/off for 2 weeks it is tearing at the thumb hole! So I called Vive and they absolutely back up their 60 day guarantee!! They are sending me a new wrist brace at no cost to me and I don’t have to go through the hassle of returning this one! So I would say for the price it is definitely worth the buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Betsey

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for...I guess?
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest. Best feature is the removable splint. It wears out fast. Very thin piece of velcro across the palm especially. As with all of these that I’ve tried the thumb hole is irritating to the skin and with this one it’s beginning to come apart. These things are only $10-$15 so you really just get what you pay for. I’d rather get a solid 6 months from one of them but highly unlikely.
customer_reviews.author: Nytess

customer_reviews.title: One size does NOT fit all
customer_reviews.text: It’s better than most because it does have the splint to immobilize the wrist, needed to relieve inflammation. I have a great one from PT and this is similar. Big issue is there is only one size. I have thin hands...skin and bones, not meaty. It wraps so much that it rubs. Maybe it is just best for average hands.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: not ideal for small hands or wrist compression
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's adjustable but it's hard to get it tight because it slides around when you pull to Velcro. I know this is a brace not a compressor but I was hoping I would be able to pull it tight on my wrist. The insert makes it so you can't bend at the wrist but it still feels very loose. I myself have small hands and found it annoying that the material came up as high as it did on my palms, it made doing anything that involves closing your hand to require that little extra effort. Wouldnt say it's a bad product, just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: StarChild89w

customer_reviews.title: Questionable purchase after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to change my review. Initially, I was very happy with this brace but after some wear not so much so. I wear this brace daily for my computer work. The material around the thumb has separated and the Velcro strap has lost it's gripping ability. Still wearing the brace but I do need to rethinking my decision to buy another for my left hand. I'll be shopping around for another brace for comparison\ that will last longer than a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: mark Marsicano

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Top velcro strap too thin to hold. Material the strap attaches to is TOO WEAK to hold not like a heavy duty hook and loop Velcro. Result is it does not work after a few days. Amazon is accepting my return, thank you"
customer_reviews.author: Dennis C Becher

customer_reviews.title: Helped during sleep
customer_reviews.text: I just needed something to help when I sleep, because my hand tingling wakes me up. I put the brace on, and went to sleep and did not wake up with my hand tingling. So, in my opinion, it worked! The brace fits well, and seems to be appropriately adjustable. It is also easy to put on, since I did it in the dark!
customer_reviews.author: deanie

customer_reviews.title: Works well but may be best for 24/7 use
customer_reviews.text: The brace works well however the Velcro seems to be wearing out already. Specifically the small piece of Velcro between the thumb and index finger. Since the Velcro is wearing out it loosens easily so I have to readjust it a couple times to keep it tight. The brace is light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design around thumbhole
customer_reviews.text: After two days of use, removing the wrap 2 to 3 times per day, the material at the top of the thumb hole was badly frayed and had lifted away from the underlying brace materiel. Could no longer tighten the thumb strap to achieve the proper fit. Amazon return process was prompt and efficient, per usual.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Gilchrist

customer_reviews.title: It hurt so bad that I almost dropped my babe in the middle ...
customer_reviews.text: I had tendinitis post partum, they call it “mom wrist” where you are constantly handling your baby with a “c” shaped hand. It hurt so bad that I almost dropped my babe in the middle of the night when going to pick him up for a feed, due to an alarming sharp pain shooting through my wrist when I would do so. Enter this brace. WHEN I wore it, it took care of the problem. The velcro would scratch my baby in the middle of the night when feeding sometimes, so I stopped using it. But I will keep it in my nightstand for future babies, just wish the exterior velcro edges weren’t so sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Janae

customer_reviews.title: Leaves the hand usable while still supplying solid support to the wrist.
customer_reviews.text: An all-over good brace for wrist tendonitis. It provides for hand flexibility when playing various musical instruments. I am placing a second order to have extra on hand (no pun intended). While the wrist velcro is massive the palm strap velcro is much smaller and can wear out from overuse. I learned that it's best to use the palm strap only for adjustment and insert/remove the hand using just the wrist strap.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Meldrim

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Okay, it did smell like rubber out of the package, it lasted about an hour. It is a nice comfortable brace. You can use it with our without the metal support and the support can be adjusted to meet your needs. I have a big wrist and it fits well and can be adjusted as needed. The thumb hole is comfortable, no complaints and I am considering a second one to use when this one is washed.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Beckie

customer_reviews.title: I think it's a great product just maybe not for me
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a great product just maybe not for me. I bought this because my Dr decided I needed to wear a wrist brace at night.. The first night I wore it.. it left a huge blister on the top of my thumb at the base of it. I had my therapist cut a bigger hole and that seems to have fixed the problem
customer_reviews.author: Krista Treaster

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this didn't work out for me. I think my hand is just too small so the placement of the thumb hole made the whole brace skewered to one side instead of straight down my wrist. Not the company's fault I have a small hand. They were very understanding and immediately issued me a refund. So I highly recommend their customer service. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Have major problems with TENDINITIS comes & goes. This time I couldn't even use my right hand. This brace gave me pain free stability and 80% use of hand while it healed. Highly recommend. ☆☆☆☆☆
customer_reviews.author: Donald P Rabidou

customer_reviews.title: Only good for Very Temporary use
customer_reviews.text: This actually is a decently comfortable brace, however it's only good for a couple days. When putting it on for the third day, I noticed the area between the thumb and pointer finger where the velcro was supposed to attached to was barely there. If this had been sewn in that area, it might have helped keep it together more, but as it is, it was barely there now. I ordered a second one thinking that it might be a fluke. However, the second one was exactly the same. Two to three days of use and that's it. The velcro for the hand will no longer hold, and dangles
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sizability with these braces!
customer_reviews.text: The thumb opening and the wrist closure are really great on this particular brace. I use This for carpal tunnel issues in particular. The metal does a good job of keeping the wrist immobile, and again, I love the ability to size this properly. Whether you have a small petite wrist, or quite a large wrist, the thumb area AND the entire brace will fit you perfectly. The wrist can feel slightly sweaty when you take the brace off, hence the four starts rather than five. A nice breathable lining would help tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: soonermitzi

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my 90-yr-old mother, who broke ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 90-yr-old mother, who broke her wrist badly a couple of years ago and is now using a walker. She still has a lot of pain and this helps to support the wrist when pressured by leaning on the walker handle.
customer_reviews.author: C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement brace for one that I had been on an off as needed for years. It seems to be well made and it's comfortable . I get the support that I need and the price was right. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jake J.

customer_reviews.title: improve my right wrist.
customer_reviews.text: This my third attempt to uses an aid for my 79 year old wrist. This is the best one so far. two others of the glove type do not work as good as this type, for me. Only complaint is the velcro requires occasional rework (fluff up).
customer_reviews.author: Henries

customer_reviews.title: Not for small people
customer_reviews.text: One size fits most? It didn't fit me. It was too big. I'm a 5'2" mesomorph; when I put this thing on, the internal stiff support rests on the hypothenar (pink side palm) muscles, which is neither comfortable nor functional. In order to keep the support in the center, I have to strap the thing really tight, which cuts off blood flow, further reducing comfort and functionality. I'm sad I wasted money on this.
customer_reviews.author: DavyMac

customer_reviews.title: Fits pretty well. Thumb hole too small
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the three I bought that came with a small thumb hole, making it uncomfortable to wear without enlarging the hole. Metal insert stays in place well, and it's pretty comfortable otherwise
customer_reviews.author: mirknight

customer_reviews.title: Smells like petroleum (oil)
customer_reviews.text: The brace is nice and lightweight. Good support. But after a few days I found that the oily smell coming from the brace. The longer I use it the more it smells, even after taking it off after work. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Skip this.
customer_reviews.text: It is comfortable. And the price is right. But. It quickly started stretching out and because it doesn't breathe, it gets sweaty and smelly. I replaced this with a BraceUp brace with two support strips, top and bottom, which is more stable, comfortable and breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Merianm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Brace
customer_reviews.text: This has really improved my carpul tunnel issues. My doctor told me to wear it at night and over the course of 45 days it has really reduced the numbness in my fingers! I was also told that you need a brace with a splint in it as this prevents you from curling your hand which is something we do naturally when we sleep..
customer_reviews.author: HMan

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but very effective
customer_reviews.text: A little bit of a learning curve to hold, pull, and secure with one hand in order to secure at the right fit. Very helpful, wrist felt better in just two days with extra support and reminder to let it rest!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This support does the job. The velcro is covered well so it doesn't grab on your clothes. The only thing I don't like is that when I adjust the top strap, there is a huge wrinkle in the support. After about an hour this is very irritating. Having said this, I've never had a support that didn't do this, so I guess it's the price you pay '
customer_reviews.author: Jayhawk Gal

customer_reviews.title: Takes the pain away instantly
customer_reviews.text: I have been a nail tech for 35 years and I use this ever day. It’s my 3rd one, I have tried other brands and they don’t fit as well. I’ve had to get more because the dust from nails gets in the Velcro and it stops working but it’s after months and months of use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea. But not for small featured people
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea. But not for small featured people. My wrist is 6" and my hand is small width. The hand part was definitly for wider hands. The splint ended up on the edge of my palm instead of in the middle and to make it tight enough,pulls the thumb up above the back of the hand. None of these "One size" things work for small hands.
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: Can't tell much difference yet
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in a timely fashion and is as described. I have only worn it at night for three nights and can't tell much difference yet. Hoping it will help as time progresses. As some others posted, it does have an odor, even though I washed it. It isn't unbearable though.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: For this for my son who often has pain and swelling in the wrist from an old basketball injury. It is supportive, well made and I like that the splint can be removed.
customer_reviews.author: Linny

customer_reviews.title: I can sleep in comfort and wake up with much less pain and swelling!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second product for my hands I have purchased from This company ! The brace is very comfortable, easy to put on and it is working ! Mornings are much more comfortable wearing the brace , it was recommended by a Physical Therapist. I would recommend this to anyone with arthritis or wrist issues .
customer_reviews.author: CORRINE CRONIN

customer_reviews.title: Not the right fit...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a left and right brace to help with CT. To my surprise, each brace was slightly different, specifically the velcro. One looked like what I'd expect and the other looked like the ran out of the right material and improvised. The thumb holes were way too small on both as well, but I rolled with it. After making some cuts to enhance the comfort of the thumbs and velcro, I had a pretty good first week with them, but after that, not so much. The fabric can't handle the velcro and was showing heavy signs of wear after the first week. I'm on to a new brace from another vendor at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's not bulky. The support feels very comfortable.....and it's adjustable. I'll probably order one for left hand.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: VERY uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended that I sleep in these braces to help with my CTS. I bought one for each hand. I wasn't even able to keep these on all night. I think I may have had a reaction to the material around the thumb hole. The thumbs on both hands were red and swollen and had a groove around the base. I bought another brand that fit differently and did not have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Terri R

customer_reviews.title: Super Sweaty
customer_reviews.text: The stability from this brace would have been great if I could have handled the suffocating feeling of the neoprene material. It would have been better if there were some slits that allowed air movement. Unfortunately I won't be able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: E_To_The_G

customer_reviews.title: The price was decent
customer_reviews.text: The thumb hole has no stitched beading around it, looks to have just been cut out, which allowed the fabric to peel away from the neoprene making it uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Boroughs

customer_reviews.title: B minus...
customer_reviews.text: Great support as a soft wrap. The removable splint, not so great. A srtip of ridgid plastic that is stiff enough, but uncomfortable at best and angled wrong. If you need something very stiff there are better choices. The hole for the thumb is too small without a little stretching. Not a long term solution, but as a soft wrap, fairly comfortable. Rinses nicely (which needs to be done often).. Good price
customer_reviews.author: Richard Tornblom

customer_reviews.title: So comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this brace! It's comfortable, supportive, and exactly what I needed. The only thing I'll note is that mine is definitely better for my left hand, (which is what I needed!) But I wouldn't be entirely sure how to adjust it for the other side. All in all, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: I have R.A these are ok if your desperate. Not much relief. There pretty long not for the average size women’s hand im a size medium in gloves FYI
customer_reviews.author: Kmh

customer_reviews.title: Helps me sleep comfortably at night and ease the pain of carpet tunnel
customer_reviews.text: Helps me sleep comfortably at night and ease the pain of carpet tunnel. I only ever use it for about an hour at a time or overnight when I'm not moving much and it hasn't caused me any discomfort. I don't use it heavily or constantly, however.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny BothersTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit.
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small wrist. This does not fit. It was uncomfortable and wouldn't tighten to my hand or wrist properly so it kept sliding. I do NOT recommend this if you have smaller than average hands or wrist. However it is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Redmon

customer_reviews.title: support is good
customer_reviews.text: served it purpose when new, over time the velcro wore out. the piece that go towards the wrist has to be continuously adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: MBenz

customer_reviews.title: Not supportive enough
customer_reviews.text: The product does not give the support that it needs to give it fits loose even when tightening straps. The strap that goes on thumb is very uncomfortable. It it to wide to fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Frye

customer_reviews.title: love the pricing
customer_reviews.text: The wrist brace is very comfortable when I wear it. It gives me a lot of support because I fell 3 years ago and broke my right wrist in 3 places. I can not have surgery because it would not do any good. The specialist told me that if I had surgery as andbwent thru therapy after I start using it there is a possibility that I would loose the use of my right hand. I can not lift anything and can not turn my right hand anymore.
customer_reviews.author: margo harris

customer_reviews.title: This wrist brace did exactly what i needed it to do! It helped with pain and kept me from reinjuring my wrist.
customer_reviews.text: The tendon pain in my wrist was very painful, to the point where I would wake up several times in the night. This brace put all the right pressure in all the right places, and it helped my wrist to finally begin to heal after having reinjured it several times. I'm not going to complain about something as silly as a smell (which fades!) when I purchased this with the purpose of pain relief and to aid in healing.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Nasty blister
customer_reviews.text: Not at all breathable, in fact due to that fact I have a painful blister. I would send it back but I already tossed the box If I can send it back without please let me know
customer_reviews.author: bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Too much brace!
customer_reviews.text: This brace almost completely immobilizes my hand, so it's ok to sleep in but I can actually still work in the futuro brand of brace. It's impossible to get anything done in this. I don't want to be unable to use my hand at all! That's not what the brace is for.
customer_reviews.author: Chwisty Bawwett

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Initially it was great, provided good support but after using it a week the edges were unraveling and the support bar had cut through, causing a tear
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hazelton

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I hate this brace!The section between your thumb and fingers is too wide, so it irritates that area. The support is minimal and I do not feel the "brace" that is supposed to be inside. The bad smell has also never completely gone away, though it is not as strong. I went back to my old futuro brace, This was a low enough price, that I didn't feel like the shipping cost to return would be worth the effort. It now lives in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: You can only use a few time because the Velcro gets destroyed and it won’t stick anymore. It’s comfortable though. If you only have to wear it for a short while I would recommend. I broke my wrist and wore it after I got out of the splint.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Lack of breathability, and hands still get numb and tingly with these.
customer_reviews.text: These braces are okay, better than nothing. I was barrowing a different pair from a friend while suffering from carpal tunnel due to pregnancy, and they were great. I decided to order some of my own online and saw the great reviews for this product, so decided on these. Compared to the others that felt great, I wake up with these ones and my hands are still tingly, and sweaty hot. These ones are not as easy to adjust to the perfect fitting as the others I was using either. I would rather wear these than nothing at all, but not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: There is no top support so might as well not have it on it also keeps the heat in so gets smelly real quick
customer_reviews.author: laura lucas

customer_reviews.title: Good brace if I needed a left hand brace.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a right hand brace. On arrival the box is for a right hand brace but the actual brace is for a left hand. If I put it on right hand, the splint is on top of my hand instead of palm side so it can't be a right handed brace. Other than being for the wrong hand, it seems to be a good quality brace.
customer_reviews.author: RNkim

customer_reviews.title: Good for some moderate support.
customer_reviews.text: I've been having some carpal tunnel issues, so I needed to pick up a brace to wear when it flared up. This does the job well. It's a little strange to apply, but once it's on, it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: The brace is good for support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to support my wrist while typing daily. The brace is good for support, however it has a strong scent. I'm sure its due to the material its made from. It smells like sweat and it has my wrist smelling as well. I thought it would be something like the waist belt I use when working out, but that doesn't smell like this wrist brace does. If you purchase, be sure to wash your wrist really good or else it will continue to smell after removing the brace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable for smaller hands.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for after crocheting, so I don't cause more damage afterwards. It works well for the most part, but my hand is on the smaller side (I wear youth winter gloves), so when I adjust it above the thumb, I get a bit of a wrinkle in the brace where my palm is. Otherwise, it's a good product, does what it needs to, and I like that it's thinner than what I could buy at the store.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie A. Cosgrove

customer_reviews.title: the fit is great.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but hate the odor. I soaked it in a dash of dish soap as others did and air dried. Its a lot better but still a small odor lingers. I still use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: dogtails50

customer_reviews.title: Unwieldy and Ill fitting
customer_reviews.text: I used this for general relief and support of a strained wrist. The metal piece does not really allow much usage in doing things and the upper strap is not very useful. I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Peace/Skol

customer_reviews.title: May cause a rash.
customer_reviews.text: The material caused me too break out into a bad rash that took awhile to clear up . Washing and trying again afterwards didn't help. I thought it may have been a finish or something on it because it was new but, no just the material. I have never been sensitive to any type of material before . I liked the design though. I had no problems with getting a refund. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crap, totally worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. The velcro straps tear the material off. After a week of wear they are totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Howard

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product began to fall apart within a week of daily use. The fastener immediately starts fraying the elastic, and wrist side support is unsubstantial and feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: C. O. B.

customer_reviews.title: Stinks very Badly
customer_reviews.text: Really strong horrible odor..even after washing with vinegar. It is comfortable and elevates my discomfort but I’m not ok with walking around smelling like a brand new tire...
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: It's comfortable but wears out quickly
customer_reviews.text: It's the un hemmed thumb hole that wears in about a weeks time. Theres nothing to stop a crack that starts in the rubbery material the thing is made of from spreading. other than that I liked it.
customer_reviews.author: LardBeast

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: In less than 1 month, the fabric surrounding the opening for the thumb is all separated from the rubberized base of the brace. I am concerned that with further use, the Velcro closure will not be able to hold. I am using the product of on advice of my physician for a preliminary diagnosis of carpal tunnel. the brace works well, but the quality of the brace is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: i.d.luckower

customer_reviews.title: Helps SO Much
customer_reviews.text: It Just came, I was in wicked pain, it helped as soon as I put it on. EXCELLENT Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: LadySelene

customer_reviews.title: Not quite a 'one size fits most'
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice support wrap. However, one size fits most if almost true. I am using it, but it is basically a bit too large. I am a 5'4" woman with average size hands. I cannot use it with the metal insert & also cannot get is quite as tight as I would like. I live alone & cannot hold it tight enough to fasten it tighter. However, the velcro is super strong which is nice. It is comfortable to wear. If my hands were larger I think it would be perfect for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Monico

customer_reviews.title: Just a FYI if you’re sensitive to material/smell.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t keep them on very long at night due to the material scent. There’s a strong smell from this product being in bulk before it manufactured. In due time the scent will be gone I’m sure. My one hand is tucked under the side of my face when I sleep. The smell is strong. I have them outside and sprayed with Fabric spray.
customer_reviews.author: CAD2061

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, good brace
customer_reviews.text: I use for cycling and like the easy on/off of this simple but effective brace.
customer_reviews.author: LuuFamily

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart already
customer_reviews.text: Watch out, this product is low quality. I do not wear a brace daily, however this has already begun falling apart and I haven't even had it for a month. The area next to the thumb has become puffy (will not allow the Velcro to stay) and has come unattached from the rubber padding underneath. Look elsewhere if you want it to last more than a couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: One of the best wrist braces I've bought, even if the velco eventually wears out
customer_reviews.text: The vive wrist brace is about as comfortable as wrist braces can get. It's straightforward and easy to put on, and it immobilizes your wrist very well. I think it might be the most effective brace I've bought on Amazon. My only real issue with it is that the velcro eventually wears out. Which is pretty much my issue with any wrist brace I've used. That's not necessarily a problem with the brace itself, because velcro always wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: 66 year old opinion
customer_reviews.text: I’m pleased with the product; trying to find the ‘magic spot...’ that positions my hand that relieves the numbness in my thumb... making progress; time will tell and I’m optimistic this product will assist in this process...
customer_reviews.author: pauldhacs

customer_reviews.title: Feel apart quick.
customer_reviews.text: Started falling apart the first week, loop of thumb hole split and velcro stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Brodzinski

customer_reviews.title: Small Price to Pay for Proper Protection!
customer_reviews.text: I recently suffered a hairline fracture of my wrist. Not bad enough for a cast but to help protect me from myself (!) I purchased this wrist support. GLAD I DID! Very supportive - and protects my injury, preventing it from getting worse and allowing it to heal properly. For $12.99, it keeps me out of the orthopedist's office! Wearing it for 10 days did the trick. Feels great now.
customer_reviews.author: Genie

product_meta.title: Vive Wrist Brace - Carpal Tunnel Hand Compression Support Wrap for Men, Women, Tendinitis, Bowling, Sports Injuries Pain Relief - Removable Splint - Universal Ergonomic Fit (Black, Left)
feature_bullets: PROTECT AND STABILIZE YOUR WRIST: Stabilizing and supporting the wrist, the lightweight wrist brace by Vive provides maximum support to reduce pain and inflammation and prevent re-injury. Fully adjustable, the compression brace retains therapeutic heat to improve circulation and promote healing. The lightweight brace, with a removable splint, allows the full use of your hand, so you can easily complete everyday activities.

CUSTOMIZABLE COMPRESSION THERAPY: Two adjustable straps allow you to customize the amount of compression to effectively reduce pain, inflammation and swelling. Great support brace for arthritis, carpal tunnel, tendonitis, repetitive stress injury, post-surgery, sprains and strains.

REMOVABLE SPLINT FOR FLEXIBLE USE: A lightweight, durable splint stabilizes the wrist in a neutral position for optimal relief. The splint is also removable, allowing you more flexibility while providing adequate wrist support.

ADJUSTABLE LIGHTWEIGHT DESIGN: Universally sized to accommodate most hand sizes, the wrist support brace features two adjustable straps with extra strength fasteners for a personalized fit without slipping or bunching. The breathable neoprene keeps your hand and wrist cool and comfortable throughout the day.
VIVE GUARANTEE: 60 day unconditional guarantee so you can purchase now with confidence.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
